reviews.review_msg: The exams were marked very unfairly. All written, no multiple choice. Theyll try & take off as many marks as possible even if ur correct. The old "couldve wrote more" or "didnt have this word" which can be said no matter how correct ur answer is. The midterm was on journal articles so lectures & textbook were useless. Final was only on the textbook

this class made me cry on multiple occasions. He assigns 4-5 LONG & dry journal article readings in addition to chapters from his own book weekly (about 100 pages) & EVERYTHING IS TESTABLE lectures & tutorials are USELESS but mandatory to pass. AVOID AVOID AVOID havent even received my final grade yet but I already know its ruined my gpa

This class was a complete and utter disappointment. The only material provided is the textbook which Raymon wrote, and articles posted in modules. I did not hear from Raymond one time the whole semester, and the TA's graded unfairly, and barely respond to emails. The final exam consisted of 22 Q's that were extremely detailed, and answers in text.

This class was honestly such a disappointment. There were no lectures, just the textbook. Its written by Corrado but is so poorly structured its impossible to know whats important to study and whats not. On top of that, we didnt hear one word from Corrado the entire semester and got passive aggressive & minimal feedback from the TA's. DO NOT TAKE.

I wish I took this class distance ed bc god is he a bad prof. He posts recorded lectures on canvas, they're mandatory & you'll have to pay attention to do well on exams but he's so disorganized that his lectures will put you to sleep. He also coughs into the mic every 10 seconds and is contributing to my hearing loss. Content is easy tho.
Very disorganized. Have no idea what is on the exams, just have to hope for the best.

I took this class online. Maybe it's different in person, but the exams in this class are tough. The exam questions are extremely detailed. Even the take home final exam was hard. Class average for midterm was 55% and for the final it was 61%

He provides powepoint slides. His lectures although really interesting in my opinion, arn't neccesarily what will be on the exam. Stick to the power points and I urge you to go to tutorials and do your readings because that is where most of the test material comes from.  His exams are really fair if you know the readings & the slides. Go 2 TUTORIAL

He only appears disorganized if you fail to pay attention. Pay attention, take notes, and listen through his tangents. He ALWAYS makes his points, just not always in a clear point A to B fashion. If you want to be hand-fed lecture slides, he is not your professor. If you want an incredibly knowledgeable and passionate professor, take him.
One of the most disorganized prof I've ever had. No slides and he jumps from 1 topic to the next. Exams were fair but you have to memorize all the readings. Stay away!

Ray is extremely knowledgeable on the topic of youth crime. His lectures are fascinating and his experience with the subject makes the course worth while. Also, he is caring, laid back, and helpful.  Personally, I am very grateful for these qualities in faculty members.  That said, he expects quality work and contributions so do not expect to slack

No lecture slides, jumps all over the place. Pretty much no structure to his lectures. Read the textbook and you'll do decently. The TAs were really good and made up for what he was lacking. Not an easy class by any means but if you put in the effort you can do decently.

Let's keep this short. Talks about being Italian, starts talking about psychopathy and ends up telling you how they cut heroine. Very disorganized. Cares about his students, and is a great guy, but if you need structure, take something else. I implore you.

Good course.  Interesting lectures. He doesn't use powerpoints or any visual aids so you have to write down what he says.  Textbook is important as you need to read it to get good grades.  Presentation itself is ok but it requires effort.  His lectures however is a bit all over the place so you need to listen and take down the relevant information.

very dry. does not incorporate readings into his lectures. course is 40% midterm and 60% final. if you are not an exam type of person, this is not the course for you. and he is always late! he talks a lot about being italian. gets off topic in every class.

He is extremely knowledgeable and probably the funniest prof I've had. He tends to get off topic sometimes, but at least he knows what he's talking about! His exams are fair, and are based on his lectures/notes. Remember to go to lectures though, because he doesn't tape them.

Awesome TAs really helped us out with marks/hints. Midterm/Final = MC!! No papers or anything. Easy oral presentation and participation. Read the text, go to class, and your good to go. Fairly easy A IMO.
Ray's a good guy. Thanks for giving me a good mark dude! The dude works for the mob...

Extremely knowledgable prof. Really knows his stuff, but this make it a little difficult for students to understand. This class was more of a history class than a terrorism one. Did not like his exam setup 2 essay ?'s. However, very funny and smart. Overall: 7/10. I Would take a class with him again.
Great prof.  Interesting lectures.
Great prof.  Knows his stuff.  Willing to go the extra mile to help students.
The course is easy but the lectures are unorganized and most of the time not about info you need to know. He is very knowledgable and interesting but lectures lack organization and meaning.
Take the correspondence version - same readings, same exam, same assignments - BUT NO LECTURES OR TUTORIALS!!!
FUNNY guy felt asleep alot tho bcuz he only talks and no notes (or i missed them while i was sleeping)  pretty good prof
Good prof. Knows his stuff, but tends to go off topic.
Loved this course, lecture notes were easy to understand. I had a bad TA for the course (Fall 02) made the course difficult, but the topic was good =) would take this prof again!
One of the most interesting profs!!! He always plays the devil's advocate
dynamic lecturer!  very funny, very knowledgable!
